chunk_id: Integrated Maternal and Perinatal Care Guideline_23_10_2024_0__chunk_997
source: Integrated Maternal and Perinatal Care Guideline_23_10_2024_0
text:
routine screening for HBV, and is found to carry the infection.
 If the pregnant woman was born in South Africa after 1995, it is likely that she was vaccinated in
infancy against HBV (HBV immunization was incorporated into the South African EPI schedule
in 1995).
 This is likely to have made her immune as the vaccine confers lifelong immunity in the majority
of cases.
 Therefore, in South Africa it is pregnant women born before 1996 that are more likely to present
with HBV infection.
• Whils
